00028 #include "qk_pkg.h"
00029 #include "qassert.h"
00030 
00031 Q_DEFINE_THIS_MODULE(qk_sched)
00032 
00033 
00039 /*..........................................................................*/
00040 /* NOTE: the QK scheduler is entered and exited with interrupts LOCKED */
00041 #ifndef QF_INT_KEY_TYPE
00042 void QK_schedule_(void) {
00043 #else
00044 void QK_schedule_(QF_INT_KEY_TYPE intLockKey_) {
00045 #endif
00046     uint8_t p;
00047                       /* the QK scheduler must be called at task level only */
00048     Q_REQUIRE(QK_intNest_ == (uint8_t)0);
00049 
00050 #if (QF_MAX_ACTIVE <= 8)
00051         /* determine the priority of the highest-priority task ready to run */
00052     QPSet8_findMax(&QK_readySet_, p);
00053 #else
00054         /* determine the priority of the highest-priority task ready to run */
00055     QPSet64_findMax(&QK_readySet_, p);
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifdef QK_NO_MUTEX
00059     if (p > QK_currPrio_) {                     /* do we have a preemption? */
00060 #else                                /* QK priority-ceiling mutexes allowed */
00061     if ((p > QK_currPrio_) && (p > QK_ceilingPrio_)) {
00062 #endif
00063         uint8_t pin = QK_currPrio_;            /* save the initial priority */
00064         QActive *a;
00065 #ifdef QK_TLS                                 /* thread-local storage used? */
00066         uint8_t pprev = pin;
00067 #endif
00068         do {
00069             QEvent const *e;
00070             a = QF_active_[p];              /* obtain the pointer to the AO */
00071 
00072             QK_currPrio_ = p;     /* this becomes the current task priority */
00073 
00074 #ifdef QK_TLS                                 /* thread-local storage used? */
00075             if (p != pprev) {                   /* are we changing threads? */
00076                 QK_TLS(a);               /* switch new thread-local storage */
00077                 pprev = p;
00078             }
00079 #endif
00080             QS_BEGIN_NOLOCK_(QS_QK_SCHEDULE, QS_aoObj_, a)
00081                 QS_TIME_();                                    /* timestamp */
00082                 QS_U8_(p);                        /* the priority of the AO */
00083                 QS_U8_(pin);                      /* the preempted priority */
00084             QS_END_NOLOCK_()
00085 
00086             QK_INT_UNLOCK_();                      /* unlock the interrupts */
00087 
00088             e = QActive_get_(a);          /* get the next event for this AO */
00089             QF_ACTIVE_DISPATCH_(&a->super, e);        /* dispatch to the AO */
00090             QF_gc(e);            /* garbage collect the event, if necessary */
00091 
00092             QK_INT_LOCK_();
00093                           /* determine the highest-priority AO ready to run */
00094 #if (QF_MAX_ACTIVE <= 8)
00095             QPSet8_findMax(&QK_readySet_, p);
00096 #else
00097             QPSet64_findMax(&QK_readySet_, p);
00098 #endif
00099 
00100 #ifdef QK_NO_MUTEX
00101         } while (p > pin);      /* is the new priority higher than initial? */
00102 #else                                /* QK priority-ceiling mutexes allowed */
00103         } while ((p > pin) && (p > QK_ceilingPrio_));
00104 #endif
00105         QK_currPrio_ = pin;                 /* restore the initial priority */
00106 
00107 #ifdef QK_TLS                                 /* thread-local storage used? */
00108         if (pin != (uint8_t)0) {   /* no extended context for the idle loop */
00109             a = QF_active_[pin];         /* the pointer to the preempted AO */
00110             QK_TLS(a);                          /* restore the original TLS */
00111         }
00112 #endif
00113     }
00114 }
